resources.string: Light Meter uses the built-in ambient light sensor reading or manually set values to get Exposure Values and thus calculates the shutter speed based on ISO and aperture set by user.
Disclaimer: Ambient light sensor, if your phone has one, could be very inaccurate. Manual exposure setting is preferred for accuracy.

Usage: to use the built-in light sensor, select "Auto" as Exposure Setting and check the status message, it will say something like "Using CM3602 Light sensor" if you have ambient light sensor on the phone. Then if you place the cell phone as you would place an incident light sensor, pretend that the cell phone screen is the front side.
